website_summaries.verdict: Good build quality for a 6-ball set that's offered in multiple colors.
pros: All of the balls in the set will meet size and weight standards set by lacrosse governing organizations
You can choose from a variety of colors in the set, including multiple different colors in one set
These balls work for practice or games
cons: Some colors of these balls will have a strong, odd odor

customer_reviews.title: Awful STRONG "chemical smell" Ended up throwing them away :(
customer_reviews.text: Wow. We have purchased a different color of these same balls and they are a favorite for playing fetch with our Queensland Heeler puppy dog. But when these two blue in color balls arrived they had such an awful "chemical smell" that there is absolutely no way we will be using them. So, they ended up in the trash. I don't know if the plastics have changed but the chemical smell of these blue balls is unbearable. Literally eye watering if they are near you.
customer_reviews.author: jazzmatazz

customer_reviews.title: DANGER! Toxic chemical smell/fumes!
customer_reviews.text: The chemical smell of these balls was so horrible one can imagine at least one brain cell dying from every sniff. The smell transferred to everything that touched the ball! Whether you plan to use it for lacrosse, massage, or a dog ball, an ungloved hand or dog mouth has to touch it at some point - I think the chemical fumes coming off these balls must be highly toxic. They also seem bouncier than a lacrosse ball should be. I would rate these at a negative 5 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Cold Climate Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Bad chemical odor
customer_reviews.text: These balls are real Lacrosse balls but they stink like chemicals, and I mean bad, these are for my dog (it is literally the only ball and color he will chase). If you don't think dogs see color think again, he spits the white one out. I do digress, I have them outside trying to air them out. Cleaned a couple in soap and water, still stink.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Good massage balls
customer_reviews.text: I do not use these balls for lacrosse it I use it to massage my entire back and shoulder areas. All you need is to lean back on the back with a hard surface like a wall and you can move your body to massage the area you want, if you want to have a deeper massage than lean more meaning put more body weight on the ball. This ball is durable and hard enough while still doesn’t hurt you during your massage. It’s perfect for getting any knots out.
customer_reviews.author: Reberm

customer_reviews.title: Real Lacrosse Balls; Health Use for Me
customer_reviews.text: Real lacrosse balls (not some garbage "health" balls that are smaller or softer). I use them for breaking open tight muscles in my pecs, shoulders, back, and hips. So much better than a tennis ball (harder, so they can pinpoint tight spots better as they don't collapse in when applying pressure, and the rubber exterior won't slip around on painted walls like tennis ball felt does). Also, as a side benefit, they are fun to bounce on the floor as they bounce back hard and fast (not recommended, I guess, if you live in an apartment and have downstairs neighbors as these boys will echo thru floors like a champ). We're all a kid at heart...
customer_reviews.author: melmwood

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell makes it bad for trigger point massage
customer_reviews.text: If you came to this lacrosse ball looking for a muscle tension release aid to go along with your foam rolling, pick another one. The chemical out-gassing smell from this ball is so incredibly bad that I couldn't even leave it in my room for more than a couple hours before I had to put it outside on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: J!

customer_reviews.title: STANKY
customer_reviews.text: These balls are STANKY. Not “new ball smell” but as in “I cannot be in the same room because it reeks of the most awful chemical smell known to man.” One star for being round.
customer_reviews.author: Valorphase

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT get past the noxious stench
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased lacrosse balls that smell SO AWFUL. It’s unbearable. Intolerable. They reek of acrid raw garlic and burning plastic. So strong in odour i’m starting to get a headache. I washed them with Dawn dish liquid and it didn’t help at all. Will try a paste of baking soda and water but I have a feeling i’ll be tossing them in the rubbish where things that smell like this, belong. What a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: edg

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for use in massage ball therapy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Champion Sports lacrosse balls to use for deep muscle massage related to the osteoarthritis I have in my hips and knees. They were recommended to me by my physical therapist. I am very pleased with them. They are a perfect size, and with just the right amount of firmness to provide the deep muscle workouts I need. Since I started using these lacrosse balls for massage therapy, I have noticed a significant decrease in pain and increase in joint flexibility. The Champion lacrosse balls are very easy to keep clean, and I did not notice any odor at all. I find them outstanding for use in massage ball therapy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike PowersTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: SMELL SO BAD!
customer_reviews.text: These smell terrible! I am not overly sensitive to smells. These are insanely bad. They have the exact same smell as a mall hair salon. I thought they needed to air out for a day and then I’d be able to use them, but they have been in open air for a week and I can smell them while I’m walking up to them. There’s no way I could use them on my shoulder. I’d have a headache before I was done. These only have one job to do: be a ball. They nailed that part, but they missed on having the ball be useable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awful toxic chemical smell!
customer_reviews.text: The smell is awful! Anything that touches these balls will smell awful too. If you cannot wait a few weeks (TBD) for these stink balls to "gas off", then you should not buy these. I now think that the reason these are cheaper than the ones I see at my sporting goods store, is that they do not let then gas off during manufacturing, before packaging or shipping. I now wish I did not try to save money by purchasing these on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great for trigger point massage!
customer_reviews.text: These lacrosse balls work great for trigger point massage, as recommended by my physical therapist. Yes, they're hard as a rock (as they should be), so be careful when first using for massage. I was a little overzealous, and the following day I felt like someone had punched me in the back and butt! They're sturdy, and the pricing is better than balls listed under "trigger point massage." I wrapped mine up in multiple layers of plastic wrap, side by side, again as recommended by the therapist. Use them by laying on a yoga mat, with the balls between me and the mat. Roll your problem areas over the balls and apply pressure. Hurts so good!
customer_reviews.author: jellybean55

customer_reviews.title: Use for physical therapy to break up muscle and relieve tension in shoulders
customer_reviews.text: Used for self massage and losing tension in shoulders from a long day of sitting and studying. Also used for physical therapy in recovering from shoulder tendonitis in my doctor's office, so I bought my own. Please don't buy the Giaiam ball product because it slips and slides and is difficult to control and can cause further injury. The La Crosse ball has a rubber grip to prevent sliding and is flexible enough to not crush muscles too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF TOXIC SMELL
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listened to other reviews. I'd give this item 0 stars if I could, the smell is unbearable. I'm leaving them on the deck for a week to try and let it dissipate before I return them but even if it goes away, the smell is unacceptable. WHAT ARE THESE MADE OF??? It smells like something that would kill an insect or a small mammal. --- UPDATE: One month later. The smell has not dissipated in the slightest. Literally un-usable.
customer_reviews.author: katatat

customer_reviews.title: Great for shoulder massages
customer_reviews.text: These lacrosse balls are just like all other lacrosse balls, at least to my knowledge. I am not a lacrosse aficionado and I have no idea whether various features of lacrosse balls make any difference. But these balls are to be used for shoulder massages, which, among other things, means that they need to be easily located. The color pattern on these balls assures that they are easily located, unless they have been stored against a mottled-color background. In that case, they will be as easily located as your neighborhood chameleon. My wife likes them and uses them for her shoulder pain, so they meet the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Stalwart

customer_reviews.title: They’re my puppers new favorite
customer_reviews.text: Forget expensive K**g balls. These are the bomb as confirmed by this happy customer. Weighty and the perfect size Xs 6.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming chemical smell that will haunt your dreams
customer_reviews.text: The smell. The reviews warn of this, of course, but the star ratio combined with low price convinced me not to read them. Big mistake! The smell! I can’t have this ball in the house. Unbelievably potent chemical smell unlike any other petrochemical product I have purchased that “off gases”. Does not seem to dissipate with time, and I’m tired of waiting. The smell: do not purchase this item! No idea how it can be on Amazon at all. I’m not a complainy reviewer but good lord, I was not prepared for a product so bizarrely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great for receiving tense muscles!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for tense muscles. The ball is firm, similar to the size of a tennis ball, and is great for getting rid of those knots. With these balls it’s much easier to focus on a specific muscle group and it’s better for getting into the spots that the bigger massagers tend to miss. Only thing better is if we could find a way to make it automatic so they would move on their own LOL. Anyway I’m happy with this buy. Simple design but provides relief
customer_reviews.author: jaxm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the knots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these at recommendation for my trouble spot on my shoulder. I have two spots that regularly knot up by my shoulder blades and having these around so I can apply pressure when I need it is exactly what I needed. They are sturdy enough to provide pressure but also have a slight give so it's not rock hard. They fit in your hand nicely and you can really take them just about anywhere with you. I would highly recommend anyone with back pain or any pain that needs specific targeting to give these a try. No need for the fancy spiky type balls, the regular ol' round ones will work just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy J

customer_reviews.title: These should do the trick
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other reviewers, I did not notice any unpleasant odor. The color, as many have said, is not exactly as pictured. They’re still pretty, though. I bought these for trigger point massage since my job is very physically demanding and the pandemic has put my massage therapist out of business. They work just fine for that. My little dog seems to think all spherical items are for her, so I will have to be mindful about where I put them when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the pup!
customer_reviews.text: Nope - don't play lacrosse (at age 61, who does??), but do play ball with the pooch. Having lost several "Kong" balls (at $15 each) I figured let's try a less-expensive, but just as durable option. And so, a six-pack bag of lacrosse balls at under $15 bucks seemed like a good option. It sure was! The brilliant colors make it easy to find the ball when the dog can't (or won't), and even if one gets lost in the brush, I have plenty of spares. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah A. Daley

customer_reviews.title: Great massage tool for achy feet
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I didn’t let all the comments about the ball smelling bad deter me from buying it. The green ball I bought has a barely noticeable rubber smell that doesn’t bother me at all. I bought this as a massage tool for my high-arched feet, which sometimes develop cramps. It works well when I roll it across my sole on a hard floor. It’s a hard ball that doesn’t give when I press down while rolling, but it’s also rubber, which is more comfortable than plastic. I recommend this for dealing with muscular pain.
customer_reviews.author: Divascribe

customer_reviews.title: Human AND Canine Therapeutic
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal you’ll find on Lacrosse balls. The first one I ever held was at an Aerosti therapy appointment. Bought one and found it highly effective. Then my ball-loving, high energy dog got a hold of it, and we determined it’s the best dog ball imaginable. That’s why I bought a case of them at a super value: Some for him and some for me.
customer_reviews.author: It's Me...Jean!

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent composition for bounce
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I got the six pack primarily for juggling tricks (bouncing off floor and walls) I quickly discovered too much of a difference in bounce of a couple of them to be usable for that (until my skill gets better I guess) 4 out of 6 bounce high and the same - a couple, especially the green one, bounce like what people call a dead tennis ball. Otherwise, great colors - no chemical odor noticed - nice carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dave-by-the-Beach

customer_reviews.title: Strong (bad) smell - Otherwise, good
customer_reviews.text: Using them for myofascial release - great for that purpose. (I also used to play lacrosse, and these appear to be of the same quality as most lacrosse balls, so if you use them for that, they should be good. Also, I suspect finding these vibrant colors on the field would be much easier.) Only downside is the VERY strong smell. It's quite pungent.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING for foot pain
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy lacrosse balls when there are specific balls sold for foot pain. I made the best decision by getting these. First of all, the multi-colored ones are really cute and are therefore more inviting to use (similar to cute workout clothes). They're also a perfect density for getting home after a long time of being on your feet, rolling one under each foot and pushing down pressure. If they were any less dense, they might not be as beneficial. These are also a great deal. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mokotch

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves chasing
customer_reviews.text: I have heard that tennis balls are bad for dogs since theyre so hard and made for concerete. I played lacrosse for 5 years so I had the balls just in the backyard and my dog would always choose the lacrosse ball over the tennis ball. They are softer on their teeth. I also got blue since dogs see in rays of blue. I ordered this product multiple times for my 100 pound chocolate lab
customer_reviews.author: Mary Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Chemical Odor
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used lacrosse balls for many years for self administered trigger point therapy. I have never bought one lacrosse ball until now that have had this kind of toxic chemical odor. I washed them in soapy water and hung them in their carrying bag outside overnight on a cool night to try to remove the odor...with no success. They’re sitting next to my bed as o lay here stretching and typing this. The odor is so strong it’s giving me a headache. Unacceptable. I’ll be returning these. If this company chooses to send me new ones with NO odor then I’ll take this incidence as an anomaly and will remove this negative review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for dog toy.  Indestructible (except by lawn mower)
customer_reviews.text: The only ball our dog can't destroy. We've tried tennis balls, racquet balls, baseballs, softballs, golf balls, and every ball sold at pet stores. No matter what we tried he would just tear them to shreds. A friend suggested Lacrosse balls so we gave them a try. We had one for about 3 years then a run in whit the lawn mower finally damaged it enough that we ordered some new ones. I'm sure they're great for lacrosse too...
customer_reviews.author: SBMc

customer_reviews.title: They saved me!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little balls! I got them because I was working out A ton and I had some knots I needed to get out. Well a few weeks after I got these I was rear ended and had to see a chiropractor. He recommended me to get some of these balls and I already had them and he showed me specifically how to use them in certain areas. Now I use these little suckers all the time! And glad they came with 2 because I already lost one 🤣🤣.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Durable to tough chewing dogs
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever who is ball obsessed love these balls. They are not too hard where I am afraid of damaging something if it gets hit when I toss the ball and it is durable enough that she can not easily destroy it. She loves to carry these around and just hold them in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: They SMELL SO TOXIC
customer_reviews.text: These balls smell like that are made of superglue, cancer, and the tears of oppression. Seriously, please don’t buy them. I am returning them. TOXIC SMELL.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Balls!
customer_reviews.text: Using mainly for loosening glute and hip flexor tightness but provides relief for the occasional shoulder blade or upper back knots. I had been using a tennis ball but the slight give didn't provide the deep pressure necessary to work out knots or relieve tension. Easy to use these on a wall or floor for hitting the perfect spot. This can be somewhat torturous (in a good way) depending on your leverage and pressure applied.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rolling Feet Out
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for massaging your feet or other parts of your body - working similar to a foam roller just with less surface area and a bit harder. I got these specifically because they are small and lacrosse balls are the best balls I've found for rolling out my feet (tennis balls and some other kinds are just too soft) and I can keep one in my purse of backpack, so that I can roll out my feet if I'm not home if I need to. They are good, hard lacrosse balls just like I was looking for and work great for what I got them for!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stinky Chinese Balls!
customer_reviews.text: I wish could give 'black holes' instead of one star. When they arrived I placed them in my sons LAX bag in my car the day before a LAX tournament. It is hard to describe how bad car smelled the next day when we got ready to go to the tournament. I quickly determined that the smell was eminating the LAX balls. I considered hanging them from the bumper of my car like a set of truck nuts to air them out - but I threw them in the garbage. The chemical smell infused my sons uniform. These are the worst smelling spherical chemical weapons from China. Trump is right - we are under attack!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This ball is great and now smells great
customer_reviews.text: Beware of the chemical smell of this ball when first open the package. I submerged this ball in a container filled with fabric softener for about 3 days. I rinsed the ball and was surprised to find that the chemical odor was no where to be found. This ball is great and now smells great. I used this in my workout warm up to massage muscles.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight muscles, & as a chew toy for puppies
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my Great Danes. My Great Dane puppy is a major chewer & these are literally the only "toy" he still has not been able to destroy (& he really tries daily). I did keep one of the balls to use for getting knots out of muscles in my back, neck, feet, hands, etc. It works so well that I seriously prefer this method to most others. So 5 stars all around; my dog still can't destroy these & I have less knots in my shoulders neck & back! 😃
customer_reviews.author: CChilds1217

customer_reviews.title: Extremely TOXIC odor, not even exaggerating.
customer_reviews.text: Before buying, I saw a few reviews mentioning the toxic odor. How bad could it be, figured people must be exaggerating and bought a pair regardless. OMG.... the odor is SO STRONG and very chemical. You can smell it from far, and it makes me feel like just holding or breathing near the ball will make me sick. I've tried washing the smell away without luck so far. If nothing works, I'll probably just end up throwing them.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Skalli

customer_reviews.title: Great balls!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use these for lacrosse. I place them on the floor and lay on them on my back and move around as a cheap form of self massage. And for that purpose, they're great! Just solid enough for good pressure to back muscles with a slight amount of give. Same size as billiard balls, or very slightly smaller than a tennis ball. I'm not sure what the "scent" means but I gave it one star cause these come in a net bag and don't smell like roses or mint or something.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Multicolor does not look anywhere near as advertised. Okay otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2-pack Multicolor The images you see are beautiful.... but... you can tell that my motive for purchasing was largely due to how they looked. haha. I think they should post more actual ball samples though... But they look great and should take a beating. Buy them because they function and are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: good for myofacial release
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a gift for the gym where I work out. Not only are they fun to just bounce around the gym, but they make a great massage tool for tight back muscles. They do smell to high heaven though. I opened the plastic bag and had to let them air out. The smell doesn't stick around long once you start using them, but YUCK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Krista G

customer_reviews.title: Great for Muscle Knots!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to roll out muscles knots. They work great. These do have a weird smell to them but it’s not too overpowering and I’ve noticed it’s faded a bit since I got them. The colors I got were more red/white/blue than the pink/purple but I don’t mind that. Just something to keep in mind if you really wanted those exact colors.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: It hurts so good!
customer_reviews.text: My hip has bee killing me lately. Since being in the house, i havent been able to go out as i needed and so my hip has been locking up. I bought this loosens it right up once you find the sweet spot. It will hurt. But it will hurt the same way rolling out a tight muscle hurts before the sweet, sweet relief.
customer_reviews.author: Hakudoushinumber9

customer_reviews.title: No smell, great quality ball
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to purchase to use as a massage ball and initially I was reluctant to buy from the reviews complaining of a chemical odor smell but since it's really not that an expensive of a purchase I pulled the trigger. Turned out it was fine, ball is good and no chemical odor. Not sure what the issue with the other reviewers was.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great for massaging
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for massaging, not lacrosse. It succeeds at its purpose. The only comment I will say is that the ball has a lot more blue in it than the photo represents. This does not bother me, and I actually like it better. The 3 photos attached are all the same ball. Good price for a 2 pack.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mogg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but not pink/purple
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for muscle massaging. I ordered purple-pink ones, but I received very very blue with a little streak of pink. I took a pic of the most pink one, as you can see it's super blue :) Can't be bothered to send them back because of something like that but good to be aware if you care about the colour. They also smell very strong, so deducted another star for that.
customer_reviews.author: NahNoNamw

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming chemical smell.
customer_reviews.text: These stink like toxic chemicals. I aired them out, washed them, nothing changed. I purchased these for massage therapy, but I wouldn't want to use them since they stink so bad. I also don't want to deal with returning them since my printer is down, I'll just trash them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: amazing for trigger point massage
customer_reviews.text: a lot of people complain about the strong chemical smell in the reviews, and i did get a waft of the odor upon removing the product from the packaging, but it did not linger nor did it bother me at all. these are great for trigger point massage after long runs as i find foam rollers and massage guns aren't quite focused or intense as when i use these lacrosse balls. i use them mainly for trigger point massage on my calves and glutes... and i can literally feel my muscles release as i'm applying pressure. great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Lacrosse balls set of 6
customer_reviews.text: As far as function, any color will work but I did not receive the exact items I ordered. 5 stars as far as function but 3 stars so purchasers can watch out for a 'switch'! Item shipped to me was not as described. I ordered a set of colored balls in a mesh bag. I got 6 white balls in an unsealed plastic bag and the items were all loose in the box. Here is the description of the item I ordered: Includes 1 of each of the following colors: white, blue, orange, yellow, green, and multi-colored NCAA and NFHS approved Packed in a reusable mesh bag Includes 6 lacrosse balls
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball! QL muscle finally relieved!!!
customer_reviews.text: This ball saved me from further lower back pain and misery AND chiropractors trying to screw me. Low back pain? Try smashing your QL with this ball. Lower back pain each morning is gone. After each squat day I got my QL with this ball to make sure I tenderize that muscle and not deal with what I have in past.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviewer007

customer_reviews.title: These are High Quality Lacrosse Balls
customer_reviews.text: I like the roundness and firmness of the "rubber" compound and uniformity. I have bought 5 of them. I even froze one to test the "bounce" performance and was surprised the ball bounced higher than I had estimated, about 75% as high as a room temperature bounce. Super durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal E. Franssen

customer_reviews.title: It really does help sciatica
customer_reviews.text: At the suggestion of my P.T. guy I bought this to use for sciatica pain. I lay on my back on the floor, which is an adventure itself. I put the ball under the part of my back that hurts the most and roll around on it. Yes, it hurts, but does seem to help. When it gets very annoying I get up. Being next to a chair or couch helps.
customer_reviews.author: Pat32

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: The balls themselves are fine. But they arrived new in package with a TERRIBLE plastic/gas smell. it took several weeks for it to fully dissipate. I bought these for work and i was unable to have them in my office for several weeks. I tried airing them outside for a while, and finally just decided to get rid of them. i set them aside and forgot about them. when i noticed them several weeks later, they no longer had the smell. not sure if they all have this smell, but just beware
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Versatile...
customer_reviews.text: So many uses outside of lacrosse for these balls. I use them as fake fruit (oranges) in my fruit bowl, to make it look like I'm a healthy eater. They are easy enough to throw like a baseball, but can leave a bruise when you want to annoy your neighbors for walking on your lawn. They come in a set of 2, which is also a perfect amount for an aspiring juggler.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyInDC

customer_reviews.title: Smells Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The rubber in these lacrosse balls smells terrible. I can't stand to be in the same room with them even several weeks after they are out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers I bought this ball for self massage. It seems pretty good. Be aware that you are only buying ONE ball. The title says 'Lacrosse Balls" and the yellow pictures 2 balls. I realize this may be to illustrate the front and back but also find it to be a little misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Love these balls under my feet
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended these for stretching out the muscles on the bottom of my feet. When I sit at my desk, I take my slippers off and roll my feet over them. They are the perfect hardness to stretch out my tight feet muscles.
customer_reviews.author: WFC

customer_reviews.title: Toooooo  strong Chemical odor!!!!  Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Toooooo strong Chemical odor!!!! Don't buy it. I put it in the water even whole month, still have very very strong chemical odor!!!! I was worried that if it is bad for health.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great! Works wonderful for pinpointing pain in the lower back!
customer_reviews.text: Great! I saw a review where someone described it as a similar material as a Kong dog toy and I completely agree! I ordered this for my husband as he has a knot in his back that has given him problems for months and wanted something to really help pinpoint his pain. This helped him tremendously. I tried it myself and just beware when first starting to press gently because this will certainly hit all those areas and knots! As two people who are very into fitness and have tried many types or rollers and massagers for pain this is one of our favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole T

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Lacrosse Ball Set
customer_reviews.text: Bought the lacrosse balls as a gift for our granddaughter just becoming interested in girl's lacrosse. The colors added some fun to learning the new skills and learning to play. The combination of colors added fun for friends to chose their color of lacrosse balls and have some fun.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: This definitely helps with the back pain. Simple ball and very sturdy which helps relieves the pain. You won't lose this ball, it's bright enough to be spotted anywhere in your home. Also this is nice to bring in the office to relieve stiff neck.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Dogs refuse to play with
customer_reviews.text: Again top complaint is Smell , the chemical smell is so bad that my dogs refuse to play with them witch is absolutely insane because I dogs with just about play with any ball covered in anything you could imagine that just gos to show u how bad these balls are
customer_reviews.author: Chris frankhauser

customer_reviews.title: THE STENCH
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I soak these in soaps or detergents for DAYS on end, the chemical smell won’t go away. I am disgusted at the willingness of a manufacturer to make a product with this strong of a smell that a month later does not go away. Would give this 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan A.

customer_reviews.title: Pain away!
customer_reviews.text: These lacrosse balls are great. A physical therapist recommended these many years ago for my chronic upper back pain. I use them daily and can tell a difference if I forget to do it one day! I did not notice any odd small with these balls.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: There smaller and harder than what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: These were smaller than what I expected and harder, but that's okay to. I haven't had a chance to try out the message therapy part of it yet. I'll update when I do and let you know how that came out. My great grandkid's love them.
customer_reviews.author: J Aistrop

customer_reviews.title: my feet love this!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't say that I play lacrosse...but this ball is wonderful for rolling out sore muscles. Specifically, I love to use it on my feet. I stand all day for work so this really helps to relieve soreness at the end of a long day. Much more effective than tennis balls because they are much stronger and firmer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for Fetch
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what I’m reading about the chemical smell so I cannot touch on that but the ones I got did not have an odor. I’m sure it can go away with a wash. But anyways, this is the best fetch item because my dog will always chew up and break tennis balls or any other ball not of this magnitude and this is the only one that stands the test of time. Also good for rolling out the bottom of your feet or just any muscle in general. Probably good for lacrosse as well haha.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Smelly possibly toxic?
customer_reviews.text: These are great for using as per my PT's advice for pain relief. Because of the noxious smell I don't really want these touching my skin. Are they just natural rubber on the outside or something offgasing and toxic?
customer_reviews.author: Boheme PDX

customer_reviews.title: Great For Rolling Out Painful Muscles
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my PT for various muscle pain in foot, hip and shoulder. Ball is good quality, heavy rubber. Has a tiny bit of give when pressed on. Originally has a slight “rubber” smell when first arrived but that is gone now. I believe this has really helped with the muscle pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Foxx

customer_reviews.title: Better than tennis balls for the dog
customer_reviews.text: Our lab LOVES chasing tennis balls. These are a nice change as they're hard rubber and bounce like crazy. He loves them. Bright yellow is easy to spot in the yard, under shrubs, in the snow, etc. Great tennis ball alternative.
customer_reviews.author: JRZGRL

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball. I’ve have been told by the experts to just get a tennis ball, or anything small and use it to roll on my instep. Well they don’t work. The tennis ball crushes under weight, the other balls are either slippery and slide away or too small, too big, not hard enough. This ball works great and my first time using it.... no more arch pain. It’s the perfect size for the arch of your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne M. May

customer_reviews.title: I bought Champion merchandise but received a Dick’s ball!
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that the 6 pack of lacrosse balls I just received from Champion were not ALL champion balls. The multicolored ball is a Dick’s ball. Why am I paying this price for a CHEAP Dick’s lacrosse ball. These balls ALL have Avery harsh chemical smell. Even after washing them with soap water, you can’t dissipate the smell. I bought these in hopes they would be good for my dog to mess around with. I’ll be sending these back for a refund. I’m more disappointed that I didn’t receive all six champion balls as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Ren K.

customer_reviews.title: Use almost daily
customer_reviews.text: Started using after going to airrosti and told to use for “rolling”. Love having several around for when I need to roll for even a minute to relieve pain in back, shoulders and other areas. Stand against wall, put ball where you want a massage and you control the pressure and movement. Better than getting a professional massage for me.
customer_reviews.author: jana

customer_reviews.title: The next day I'm all better as if I went and got my back adjusted
customer_reviews.text: I've had lumbar back problems since 2 years ago and after not getting the sports specific treatment from chiropractors, I sought out a sports chiropractor and he suggested these as trigger point therapy balls. Now anytime I exercise hard (2-3hrs a day usually) and my back hurts, all I have to do is use these and focus the pressure on areas that bother me and voila! The next day I'm all better as if I went and got my back adjusted. Couldn't be happier! I just ordered these for my dad now too!
customer_reviews.author: run2088

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell on orange balls
customer_reviews.text: These 2 orange lacrosse balls have a very strong chemical smell that was evident immediately after taking them out of the envelope, before opening the plastic bag they came in. It is terrible! I used one on my shoulder & it made my shirt smell so bad I had to change clothes. I have put them in my garage in hopes they air out soon. Very disappointed that they smell so strong. It’s one of those smells that would likely be bad for you to smell for an extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a ball obsessed dog!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my Golden who is obsessed with chasing tennis balls, but tends to chew them when she thinks another dog wants the ball. These have withheld her anxiety chewing and they are so pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan McC.

customer_reviews.title: Stinky
customer_reviews.text: Damn they smell like chemical rubber when they arrive. I let mine air out in the garage for two weeks now I have no issue. But had to hit them with mint oil to get my dog to stop smelling their odor.
customer_reviews.author: Noah C

customer_reviews.title: Rugged little ball.
customer_reviews.text: I use this ball to massage my feet after work. I stand up all day (construction) and keep one of these under my desk. Feels great and, don't worry if your dog gets a hold of it. Gave one to my buddies German Shepherd. He chewed on that thing for years. The ball outlived the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Muad'Dib

customer_reviews.title: A must have for muscle tension
customer_reviews.text: Purchase.was recommended by a friend for use on muscle knots and tension. Wow was she right. The firmness is exactly what I need for my neck and back as it does not give like a tennis ball. It fits well in my hand and does not slip. You can lay on floor and put it under shoulder or lower back.
customer_reviews.author: memeb

customer_reviews.title: Foot massager
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lacrosse balls to relieve foot pains due to plantar fasciitis in my heels and arch pain from my extremely flat feet (they are so flat, they actually suction cup to the floor). These firm lacrosse balls work perfectly to really get in there and loosen the knots.
customer_reviews.author: Santina S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for pain relief in target area
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist suggested this. I’ve been doing really well with my back stretching but every once in a while I get a sacroiliac pain just in one spot of my back. I put this bar in that area press on the wall and Wala the pain is gone
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Thieman

customer_reviews.title: They Need Air!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a good deal as I like to give them to clients as needed. Put one in the drawer at my back door and thought was going to die from chemical fumes next time I opened the drawer! Don't know how long they need to be aired out, but don't leave them enclosed in anything! Had to use carbon filters to get the smell out of my drawer. Won't be buying these again. :(
customer_reviews.author: Mo Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: These work great to get into those sore spots in the hip, back, and shoulders. Unfortunately, my dog stole one one day, and now it’s her favorite toy. For an unexpected use, they seem to make a great pet toy!
customer_reviews.author: Scherra

customer_reviews.title: Doused in chemicals DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disgusting they could sell these to people. I’m not the type that uses exclusively natural or organic products, but I opened the package and felt sick and i felt like I just huffed glue or something. It is SO OVERPOWERING, I’ve never bought a product with such a pungent chemical smell even from feet away. They expect you to put these on a gym bag and on your skin? Wtf are they thinking? Really pretty irritating I paid money for these. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Two Yellow Balls are Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter, who plays high school lacrosse. They look official with the markings and the yellow color they use. Very solid and made to last. A little expensive for two balls, but you can’t just have one!
customer_reviews.author: XANTRONIC

customer_reviews.title: We buy these in cases
customer_reviews.text: We buy cases of these lacrosse balls at our clinic to give out to patients to help with their mobility issues or to help them with temporary pain relief. I also carry one in my gym bag, travel bag, in my car, bedroom, basically everywhere just in case I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: This product has a terrible smell
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what went wrong with these lacrosse balls but they have a very strong smell. We tried everything we could to remove it, but the smell persisted. We are returning them and are disappointed. We've bought this same product before from other sellers and have no problem with smell.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great for easing muscle tension while seated at work
customer_reviews.text: I have pain in my shoulder blade area caused by too much sitting so my chiropractor suggested I buy one of these. Since they came in a TWO-PACK, I keep one at work and use it everyday! This is a good value, as my co-worker bought a single ball at HER chiropractor for $5.00.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Weldon

customer_reviews.title: These are supplied at my yoga studio for massage & people offer to buy them from me.
customer_reviews.text: I've heard they make great lacrosse balls but they also are amazing to roll around on. They provide the right resistance for deep tissue work - whether standing on one & massaging your feet or rolling it between your back and the wall - they are life changing. Buy a box, give them to the people you love and they will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Thyme Management

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive plantar fasciitis relief
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive plantar fasciitis relief in my experience. I've been putting one on the floor in front of a chair and rolling it around under my feet with increasing pressure, massaging the arches, and it's working.
customer_reviews.author: nemacolin gardener

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Bad Smell.
customer_reviews.text: The smell... I couldn't keep it in my room because it smelled so bad. This stuff smells like metal polishing cream (the toxic stuff that turns dirty metal shiny). Returned it. Never got a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: whokiid

customer_reviews.title: Great balls for relieving back pain
customer_reviews.text: I use these for back pain and they help alot. I will lay on floor with them up lean against wall. Color is not accurate to what's described but I actually like the color sent.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Stinky balls!
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as described and what I needed for the back pain and tension I experince in pregnancy right now. I gave 4 instead of 5 stars bc of the extremely potent chemical smell the balls have....they must need to stay outside and air out. Being pregnant, that really concerns me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Infante

customer_reviews.title: Right item wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my son to practice lacrosse. Ordered the blue color and received the multicolor ones. If they didn’t have the blue ones, I wished they would’ve informed me and I could have chosen a different color. Quality of the item is great. Just would’ve liked to receive the color I actually ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this sooner?!
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple tool, and just a few bucks. Really helps get at those tough knots in your back, shoulders, legs, and more. I love that it’s small so I can pack it in my suitcase when I travel. You can put as much or as little pressure as you need. I’m kicking myself for not getting this sooner. Best $5 spent in months. —From someone who gets biweekly deep tissue massages.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mertz

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: These are great lacrosse balls. I like that the package comes with 2. I sometimes use both in the same area to work out the kinks in my body without causing too much discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: exhale

customer_reviews.title: Ugh - changed their quality
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: We previously rated these a 5 but they raised the price and the quality went down. Very disappointing. I'm guessing all of the complaints that the balls smell horribly have led them to change the material slightly. Good news is they don't smell as bad. The bad news is they are not as grippy as new LAX balls should be. We preferred the bad smell and grippier balls. We will be looking elsewhere for balls to see if we can find the previous quality. We are bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Ferg Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great dog ball
customer_reviews.text: We have an aggressive chewer (boxer) and she destroys most balls for dogs. These work great and last about 3 months before she gets parts to start come off of them.
customer_reviews.author: Celticstorm76

customer_reviews.title: Like Goldilocks, just the right amount of density
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work outs and pain relief. I often keep them in the freezer to combat inflammation in my shoulder and back. They're great for releasing fascia, especially in the feet (I stand a lot for work). Plus they look like bubblegum, I mean.
customer_reviews.author: FiveSky

customer_reviews.title: Great for rehab
customer_reviews.text: Got these for rehab work on my back and they’re great. My local stores didn’t have any so just got this basic two pack so i could leave one in my gym bag and one at home and they’re great
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kirkpatrick

product_meta.title: Champion Sports Official Lacrosse Balls - Multiple Colors in Packs of 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12
product_meta.description:
HIGH PERFORMANCE 
Approved for use in high school, college, and the professional ranks by the NFHS, NCAA, and NOCSAE, Champion Sports lacrosse balls are crafted from molded rubber to optimize stick handling, passing, shot accuracy, and scoring. The construction allows for pliable and responsive performance on any field. 

OFFICIAL SIZE 
No need to train with one set of equipment for practices and then have to switch to another set when you suit up for real games. Supply your team or class with official size and weight lacrosse balls, ensuring a standard for practicing, training, and scheduled games. 

MULTI COUNT PACKS 
Stock lacrosse balls for your school, team, or personal stash. Choose from 1, 2, 3, 6, 12, count packs to have plenty for play and for backups whether you're running a physical education class, running drills, or just want to always have enough on-hand. 

MANY COLORS 
White is the standard lacrosse ball color for official games, but we've included an array of additional shades to amplify your sport. Choose from a variety of color options, including a multi-color set, to add variety to your training, better visibility in low-light conditions, or organization for team drills. 

VERSATILE 
Lacrosse balls have taken on a multi-use profile in recent years. Physical therapists use them relieve muscle knots and tension during trigger point therapy, jugglers use them to sharpen their juggling agility and skill, and they serve as a perfect fetch toy for the family dog. Buy a set for the field, the gym, the backyard, even the office for stress relief. 

-Champion Sports Official Lacrosse Balls 
-Official size and weight 
-Colors: Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, Red, Pink, Violet, White, Multicolor, and Assorted 
-Quantities: 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 count packs 
-Multi-use
feature_bullets: Official Size – Every Ball Is Official Size and Weight, Meets Nocsae Standards, Is NCAA and Nfhs Approved, and Sei Certified to Improve Shooting Accuracy and Handling During Practice and Gameplay
Multi Count Packs – Choose From a 1, 2, 3, 6, or 12 Count Set to Outfit Players in Youth Gym Classes and Summer Camps, Competing on Collegiate Teams, or Completing Training Regimens to Improve Skills
MANY COLORS - Men, women, boys, girls, and children will enjoy the uniquely colorful variety of colored gear available, making every game on the indoor court or outdoor field cool and fun

VERSATILE - Use across many platforms to improve your health and quality of life, including CrossFit, foot massage, physical therapy, back pain, sore muscle relief, myofascial trigger points, even juggling or as a toy for your dogs
